subject: Re: Novari Collective Website | Interior Design

full_threads.body:
📝 Ticket Summary: Interior Designer Filter & Layout Refinement

Detail
Description
Subject
Final Refinement of Designer Display Order and Filters
Client
Giulia Savoca (Novari Collective)
Status
✅ Resolved

Summary of Action

Giulia requested two final adjustments to the Interior Designers section following previous fixes:
  1. Filter Assignment Fix:
    • The Problem: Designers Kim and Helen were not showing up under the Sydney Interior Designers filter, appearing only under the general "All" category.
    • Action: Support corrected the data classification, and Kim and Helen are now properly assigned to the Sydney state filter.
      Display Order Update:
    • Request: Move designer Jemma Jackson to appear first on the main page display (under the "All" designers view).
    • Action: The display order was adjusted, and Jemma Jackson now appears as the top/first designer on the main listing page.
Outcome:
All display and filter settings for the Interior Designers section are finalized and correct.

Hi Giulia,

You're so welcome!

Quick update - Kim and Helen are now correctly classified under Sydney Interior Designers, so they’ll appear in the filter as expected. We’ve also moved Jemma Jackson to appear first on the main page under “All” designers.

All set on our end! If you need anything else, I’m always here to help.

Thank you so much! Just the below please:
  • Kim & Helen to show under Sydney Interior Designers (they don't appear to have a filter per state and only show under 'All'
  • If possible, move Jemma Jackson to appear first on the main page under (All) designers
Best, Giulia

📝 Ticket Summary: Reversion of Interior Design Link

Detail
Description
Subject
Interior Design Trends Link Reverted/Duplicated
Client
Giulia Savoca (Novari Collective)
Status
✅ Resolved

Issue Description

Giulia reported that a change made in a previous ticket had reverted or duplicated on the live site:
  • The Problem: The "Interior Design Trends 2025" link was reappearing under the "Recent Projects" section tab, despite having been correctly moved to the page footer as a hyperlink.

Resolution

Action Taken:
  • Support confirmed the duplication issue.
  • The redundant link was removed from the "Recent Projects" tab section.
  • The team verified that the hyperlink remains correctly placed in the footer under the 'Interior Design' section.
Outcome:
The intended navigation structure is restored, with the link correctly positioned only in the page footer.

Hi Giulia,

Happy Friday!

Thanks for the heads up - we’ve gone ahead and removed Interior Design Trends 2025 from the Recent Projects section, so everything should now be displaying correctly.

The hyperlink in the footer is also in place as intended.

I’ve attached screenshots below for reference.

If you spot anything else or need a hand with updates, we're always happy to help!

Hi Adriane,

Happy Friday! I have noticed that the changes made seem to have reverted back:



  • Interior Design Trends 2025 - is now appearing under recent projects again (instead of the hyperlink)






  • Kim & Helen to show under Sydney Interior Designers (they don't appear to have a filter per state and only show under 'All'



  • If possible, move Jemma Jackson to appear first on the main page under (All) designers



Happy to jump on a teams call if that is easiest

Best regards,
Giulia

📝 Ticket Overview: Interior Designers Page Updates

Detail
Description
Subject
Interior Designers Page Updates & Filter Correction
Client
Giulia Savoca (Novari Collective)
Status
✅ Resolved (Final Adjustments Applied)

📅 Summary of Actions

Phase 1: Initial Implementation (Initial Request)

Giulia requested the following setup changes, which were all completed in the first response:
  • Hyperlink Relocation: Moved the "Trends" link from its current tabs to the page footer under the 'Interior Design' section.
  • Cleanup: Removed a persistent blank/placeholder image showing under all designer profiles in the 'Meet our Interior Designers' section.
  • Filtering: Implemented state-based filtering for the designers (Melbourne & Sydney), similar to the property stylists section.

Phase 2: Data Refinement & Final Tweaks

After reviewing the new filtering feature, Giulia provided feedback requiring immediate adjustment:
  • Data Fix (Sydney Filter): Reported that designers Jemma and Angelique were missing from the Sydney filter results (a separate apology confirmed Cassandra was visible).
  • Content Update: Requested Jemma's title be updated to "Head of Interior Design."
  • Layout Priority: Requested that Jemma appear as the first designer in the list.

Phase 3: Final Resolution

  • Action Taken: Support (Adriane) fixed the data configuration, ensuring Jemma and Angelique now correctly appear under the Sydney filter. Jemma's title was updated, and she was configured to appear as the lead/first designer in the list.
Outcome:
All structural updates, filtering, and data integrity issues have been resolved.

Hi Giulia,

Thanks for the update!

We’ve fixed the issue with the Sydney designer filter - Jemma and Angelique are now appearing correctly. We’ve also updated Jemma’s title to Head of Interior Design, and she’s now showing as the first designer in the list.

If there’s anything else you’d like adjusted, just let me know - always happy to help!

Apologies, Cassandra is there. Solely Jemma & Angelique.

Can you kindly have Jemma appear as the first designer 😊

Kind regards,
Giulia

Hi Adriane,

Thank you for your help with the below, can you please edit the Sydney Interior Designers as the following are not showing under the 'Sydney' tab


  • Jemma


  • Angelique


  • Cassandra



Can you also please update Jemma's title to 'Head of Interior Design'



Kind regards,

Hi Giulia,

Thanks so much for reaching out - and welcome to the Novari team!

Quick update: all the requested changes are now done. Here’s what we updated for you:
  • Interior Design Trends 2025 link:
    Added “Trends” as a hyperlink in the footer under Interior Design.
  • Blank designer image removed:
    The placeholder/blank image showing under all designers in the Meet Our Interior Designers section has been removed.
  • Designer filtering:
    We’ve added the ability to filter designers by Melbourne and Sydney, similar to the stylists section.

If you need any tweaks or have more updates in mind, just let me know - happy to help anytime!

action.text: Allie Borcena assigned to Adriane Roa

full_threads.body:
Hi team,

Hope you are well - My name is Giulia I have recently started at Novari Collective in the Marketing team.

Are you available to help edit the below on our website, in the Interior Designers section.

  • Move Trends https://novaricollective.com.au/interior-design-trends-for-2025/ to be added as a hyperlink at footer of the page under Interior Design, it currently is located in the tab 'Interior Design' and 'Recent Projects' and we cannot change this on our end
  • In 'About' under 'Meet our Interior Designers', there is a blank image showing under all designers. Can you please help remove:

  • We also would like to filter the designers by state if possible, Melbourne & Sydney. Similar to how the 'Meet our Property Stylists' are under the About section

Please let me know if you have any questions for me, happy to jump on a quick call.

Thank you in advance

Best,
Giulia
